item.title: Refactoring
item.description: Goal: What do I want people to walk away feeling? That decisions about the structure of code are not permanent, that it’s healthy to experiment, we shouldn’t go into too much detail with structure unless our objects reflect the domain language lines up (see DDD). Indirection only solves some problems, and always at the cost of dev ergonomics. But it does solve problems. To be successful you’re going to have to get good at making bets on what works and what doesn’t.
